text:
KEYWORDS:  WA,  Western  Pilbara,  stream  sediment  sampling,  Fortescue 
 Group, diamond. 
 ABSTRACT: 
 Exploration  Licence  47/1130  forms  part  of  the  Balmoral  Project,  a  diamond 
 exploration  prospect  jointly  operated  by  De  Beers  Australia  Exploration  Lim-
 ited (DBAE) and Tawana Resources NL. The Balmoral Project comprises of 19 
 tenements within the Western Pilbara region of Western Australia.  
 Full  results  from  collected  in  the  previous  reporting  period  became  available 
 and 14 of the 21 samples were visually positive however of the 184 chrome 
 spinel recovered only one could be considered of possible interest. This grain 
 was  recovered  from  Kallawia  Creek  headwaters  from  an  area  where  previous 
 anomalous kimberlitic type chrome spinels have been recovered. 
 Exploration  during  this  reporting  period  focused  on  further  infill  sampling 
 across  the  tenement  and  hammer  prospecting  in  the  headwaters  of  Kallawia 
 Creek. Sampling involved the collection of 8 stream samples. All results be-
 came available with only four chrome spinel being recovered and none of these 
 had kimberlitic affinity. A full assessment of all results in a regional context is 
 underway.

13.text: The  tenement  was  applied  for  on  the  4  September  2001  and  granted  on

14.text: the  24 April  2003.  Sampling  began  shortly  after  that. This  fourth  annual

15.text: report  details  the  diamond  exploration  activities  completed  over  the

16.text: tenement during the 24 April 2006 – 23 April 2007 period.

text:
number of east west facing scarps. Drainages generally flow to the west-
 northwest  in  the  southern  areas  and  are  northerly  flowing  in  the  northern 
 areas. The Hamersley Range has the highest topographic relief, Mt Elvire 
 (673m), and consists of predominately dissected country with north facing 
 scarps. These scarps define the southern boundary of the Fortescue valley, 
 a  generally  flat  plateau  capping  the  Chichester  Range.  The  Chichester’s, 
 like the Hamersley’s, are formed by gently south dipping rocks. The north 
 facing  scarp  of  the  Chichester  Range  defines  the  southern  coastal  plain 
 boundary. The coastal plain contains remnant ranges of a dissected plateau 
 eroded by a number of marine transgression and the large northerly flowing 
 rivers. The coastal plain in the project area is less than 100m above mean

 3.3  Geology (after  A.M.Thorne and A.F.Trendall 2001) 
 The project area is dominated by the Fortescue Group, a thick sequence of 
 Archaean  mafic  and  felsic  volcanic  piles  and  associated  sedimentary  rocks 
 greenstones.  The  area  straddles  the  West  Pilbara  Granite-Greenstone 
 the  Archaean  Pilbara  Craton  granite-
 that  unconformably  overly 
 Terrane  (WPGGT)  and  the  Central  Pilbara  Tectonic  Zone  (CPTZ).  The 
 WPGGT  is  dominated  by  north-easterly  trending  granitoid  complexes,

12.text: Basalts and the Jeerinah Formation volcanics and associated sediments. The

15.text: Iron Formations. Numerous minor intrusions are found within the Fortescue

17.text: surfaces  are  preserved  as  outliers  of  Robe  Pisolite  and  other  ferruginous

20.text: The  geology  within  the  tenement  E47/1130  comprises  exposures  of  the

21.text: Maddina  Formation  to  the  north  and  the  Jerrinah  Formation  to  the  south.

22.text: The Maddina Formation which comprises mainly basalt flows, pillow lavas,

23.text: fine- to coarse-grained and mafic volcanic rocks. Non-volcanic sedimentary

24.text: rocks include stromatolitic carbonate, quartz sandstone, conglomerate and

25.text: argillite.  The  Jerrinah  Formation,  which  is  believed  to  conformably  overly

26.text: the  Maddina  Formation,  comprises  argillite,  sandstone,  dolomite,  chert

27.text: and a variety of volcanic rocks including basalt flows, pillow lava, fine- to

28.text: coarse-grained mafic volcaniclastic and felsic volcaniclastic rocks.

text:
In  the  project  area  from  the  base  upwards  the  units  encountered  are  the 
 pre-Mount  Roe  sedimentary  units,  the  Mount  Roe  Basalts,  the  Hardey 
 Formation  sedimentary  and  felsic  to  mafic  volcanic  units,  the  Kylena 
 Basalts,  Tumbiana  volcanoclastics  and  associated  sediments,  the  Maddina 
 Basalts and the Jeerinah Formation volcanics and associated sediments. The 
 Fortescue  Group  is  overlain  by  the  Hamersley  Group,  in  the  project  area 
 this group is represented predominately by the Marra Mamba and Brockman 
 Iron Formations. Numerous minor intrusions are found within the Fortescue 
 and  Hamersley  Groups,  mainly  mafic  sills  and  dykes.  Young  Tertiary 
 surfaces  are  preserved  as  outliers  of  Robe  Pisolite  and  other  ferruginous 
 The  geology  within  the  tenement  E47/1130  comprises  exposures  of  the 
 Maddina  Formation  to  the  north  and  the  Jerrinah  Formation  to  the  south. 
 The Maddina Formation which comprises mainly basalt flows, pillow lavas, 
 fine- to coarse-grained and mafic volcanic rocks. Non-volcanic sedimentary 
 rocks include stromatolitic carbonate, quartz sandstone, conglomerate and 
 argillite.  The  Jerrinah  Formation,  which  is  believed  to  conformably  overly 
 the  Maddina  Formation,  comprises  argillite,  sandstone,  dolomite,  chert 
 and a variety of volcanic rocks including basalt flows, pillow lava, fine- to 
 coarse-grained mafic volcaniclastic and felsic volcaniclastic rocks.  
 RESULTS FROM SAMPLES TAKEN IN THE PREVIOUS REPORTING PERIOD 
 Results  from  the  sixteen  2005  samples  unexamined  in  the  last  reporting 
 period became available, full results for the 21 samples collected are given in 
 Table  2.    No  primary  kimberlitic  textures  were  reported  in  51  medium  and 
 133  fine  chrome  spinels  recovered. All  chrome  spinels  were  examined  and 
 only  one  grain  was  considered  of  possible  interest  in  sample  BV4816. This 
 sample  was  collected  in  Kallawia  Creek,  a  broad  alluvial  drainage  where 
 kimberlitic  indicators  had  previously  been  recovered  but  no  defined  trail  or
